results.title: As Virus Upends N.F.L. Schedule, Games Shift to Odd Landing Spots
results.abstract: The Ravens and Steelers will play on Wednesday afternoon and the 49ers announced the team will relocate to Arizona for two December games as the coronavirus surge derails pro football’s regular season.

multimedia.caption: The Pittsburgh Steelers’ game against the Baltimore Ravens will be moved back one day, to Wednesday, the third time the A.F.C. North matchup has been postponed in six days.
The Pittsburgh Steelers’ game against the Baltimore Ravens will be moved back one day, to Wednesday, the third time the A.F.C. North matchup has been postponed in six days.

results.title: New York Road Runners Parts Ways With C.E.O. Amid Workplace Complaints
results.abstract: Michael Capiraso led the organization that puts on the New York City Marathon to record revenues but will leave after employees and others raised concerns about his leadership.
results.byline: BY MATTHEW FUTTERMAN AND GILLIAN R. BRASSIL

multimedia.caption: “I understand what the board is saying, that they are making a decision after having listened to people,” Michael Capiraso, the chief executive of New York Road Runners, said in an interview.
multimedia.copyright: Karsten Moran for The New York Times

results.title: Brady Puts Up a Fight, but It’s Mahomes and the Chiefs’ Day
results.abstract: Tyreek Hill had a career day against the Buccaneers with 13 receptions for 269 receiving yards and three touchdowns.

multimedia.caption: Patrick Mahomes throws to Tyreek Hill for one of their three touchdowns.

results.title: A Gymnastics Coach Accused of Emotional Abuse Speaks Out
results.abstract: In her first public remarks since being suspended from the sport for eight years, Maggie Haney disputed accusations that led to her punishment but said she could now see flaws in the way she treated some young athletes.

multimedia.caption: Maggie Haney, the elite gymnastics coach, has been suspended for eight years by U.S.A. Gymnastics.
multimedia.copyright: Rachel Wisniewski for The New York Times

results.title: For a Day, the N.H.L. Arena Moved to the Mountains
results.abstract: Ferried by two helicopters, several N.H.L. players and a gold medal-winning figure skater played pickup hockey in a picturesque setting.

results.title: A New Outbreak Leaves a Broncos Rookie in an Awkward Position: Quarterback
results.abstract: Receiver Kendall Hinton was a last resort fill-in when four Denver Broncos quarterbacks were ruled ineligible to play in Sunday’s game because they’d been exposed to the coronavirus.

multimedia.caption: Kendall Hinton was pressed into quarterback duties when four Denver Broncos passers were ruled ineligible because of exposure to coronavirus. He connected on one of nine passes in Sunday’s loss to the New Orleans Saints.

Kendall Hinton was pressed into quarterback duties when four Denver Broncos passers were ruled ineligible because of exposure to coronavirus. He connected on one of nine passes in Sunday’s loss to the New Orleans Saints.

results.title: What We Learned From Week 12 of the N.F.L. Season
results.abstract: The Titans demolished the Colts, the Chiefs won again and the Broncos, with no quarterback, were crushed in a week defined as much by the coronavirus as the action on the field.

multimedia.caption: Tennessee’s Derrick Henry absolutely dominated in a crucial win over Indianapolis that gave the Titans sole possession of first place in the A.F.C. South.
Tennessee’s Derrick Henry absolutely dominated in a crucial win over Indianapolis that gave the Titans sole possession of first place in the A.F.C. South.

results.title: Giants Seize Share of N.F.C. East Lead but Lose Daniel Jones
results.abstract: The quarterback injured his hamstring in the third quarter and did not return as the Giants stretched their winning streak to three games.

multimedia.caption: Giants quarterback Daniel Jones injured his hamstring in the second half and was replaced by Colt McCoy. Coach Joe Judge would not rule Jones out for next week’s game in Seattle.
Giants quarterback Daniel Jones injured his hamstring in the second half and was replaced by Colt McCoy. Coach Joe Judge would not rule Jones out for next week’s game in Seattle.

results.title: Jets’ Offense Sputters in Sam Darnold’s Return
results.abstract: Miami quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick stepped in to beat one of his many former teams, and the Jets (0-11), in Darnold’s return from a shoulder injury, did not score a touchdown.

results.title: A Season of Footnotes Limps to Its Conclusion
results.abstract: The wheezing college football show goes on without some star players and highly paid coaches and with, in one case, a female kicker.

multimedia.caption: Najee Harris scored on a long run in Alabama’s 42-13 win against Auburn on Saturday. Alabama’s coach, Nick Saban, was not on the sideline because he had tested positive for the coronavirus.

results.title: For One Day, the N.H.L. Arena Moved to the Mountains
results.abstract: Several N.H.L. players and an Olympic gold medal-winning figure skater boarded helicopters bound for mountains outside Vancouver, British Columbia, to play pickup hockey in a picturesque setting.

results.title: The College Athletes Who Are Allowed to Make Big Bucks: Cheerleaders
results.abstract: Because cheerleading is not governed by the N.C.A.A., its participants can sign lucrative endorsement deals that would lead to punishment for most college athletes, including soon-to-be N.F.L. and N.B.A. millionaires.
results.byline: BY TESS DEMEYER AND ILANA PANICH-LINSMAN

multimedia.caption: Shannon Woolsey, a Texas Tech cheerleader, getting help from her roommate and fellow cheerleader, Brooke Dumas, while creating content for one of her sponsors.
Shannon Woolsey, a Texas Tech cheerleader, getting help from her roommate and fellow cheerleader, Brooke Dumas, while creating content for one of her sponsors.

results.title: Diego Maradona’s Long Shadow
results.abstract: From Ariel Ortega to Lionel Messi, dozens of players have been hailed as the next Maradona, the heir to his famed No. 10. But the fit was never perfect.

multimedia.caption: After scoring on Sunday, Messi paid tribute to Maradona by removing his Barcelona jersey to reveal a Newell’s Old Boys shirt. Messi played at the Argentine club before starting his career; Maradona spent time there near the end of his.

results.title: In the ring, neither fighter offered many surprises.
Round 8: Tyson wins the last frame (maybe) and the unofficial decision is a draw.
Round 7: Jones opens up and Tyson comes back.
Round 6: Tyson definitely went after that K.O. a few times.
Round 5: Tyson is opening up.
